At this first meeting, however, Ir.Mouton earnestly

Both Colonel Brant and my-
self vigorously supported Ir. Mouton and stated that we could not
as a o1tizens Advisory Committee, recommend that money be expended

You there-
upon assured us that a gentleman's agreement had been entered into
with Me. Mills wheredy it was asswed that purchase of the field
would be possible as soon as the City of sen Francisco secured the
necessary money.
The study, subsequent action and recommendations
of this Comittee, have been based upon this understanding that the
fold could be purchased by the City and that any expenditures
would not be wasted on property to which the City of San Francisco
could never have title.
Subsequent to the meeting of Mey 3rd, our Comittee en-
gaged in correspondence and consultation with various experts re-
garding the situation at Ills Pleld, but held no further meetings
with your Airport Committee of the Board of Supervisors, until
your call for a second meeting.
This meeting was held on
July 10th
at the Palace Hotel.
